skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: BarisSozen

security_audit.summary: This skill provides documentation and Python scripts for creating Claude skills. The scripts only create directories and files in user-specified paths using standard library operations. All static findings are false positives caused by the scanner incorrectly flagging markdown documentation examples and template strings. No network access, credential handling, or dangerous operations were found.

content.value_statement: Creating skills for Claude requires careful planning and consistent structure. This skill provides step-by-step guidance, initialization scripts, and packaging tools to help you build professional skills that extend Claude's capabilities.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new skills with standardized directory structure
Validate skill structure and frontmatter requirements
Package skills into distributable zip files
Provide best practices for skill documentation
Generate SKILL.md templates with required metadata
limitations: Does not execute user code - only creates files
Does not interact with external APIs or services
Does not modify system files or environment
Requires manual editing of generated templates

use_cases.title: Build new Claude plugins
use_cases.description: Create reusable skills that extend Claude with specialized workflows and tools for specific domains.

use_cases.title: Package team knowledge
use_cases.description: Bundle company-specific knowledge, schemas, and workflows into skills for consistent agent behavior.

use_cases.title: Create reference skills
use_cases.description: Build skills with bundled references and scripts for documentation-heavy tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Create new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the skill-creator skill to create a new skill called [skill-name] that helps with [specific task]. Set up the standard structure.

prompt_templates.title: Package for distribution
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the skill-creator skill to validate and package the skill at [path-to-skill] for distribution.

prompt_templates.title: Review skill quality
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my skill at [path] using the skill-creator guidance. Check structure, documentation quality, and best practices compliance.

prompt_templates.title: Add bundled resources
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me add a new script and reference document to my existing skill at [path] using the skill-creator skill structure.

output_examples.input: Create a new skill called 'pdf-summarizer' that helps users summarize PDF documents.
output: Created SKILL.md with template frontmatter and workflow
Next steps: Edit SKILL.md to add your skill description and workflow steps

output_examples.input: Validate and package my skill at ./claude-skills/api-generator for distribution.
output: Validating required name and description fields

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 5000 words - move detailed documentation to references/
Write specific trigger conditions in the description field
Delete example files you do not need before packaging
anti_patterns: Leaving TODO placeholders in published skills
Duplicating information between SKILL.md and references/
Creating skills without clear trigger conditions

faq.question: What tools support Claude skills?
faq.answer: Skills work with Claude and Claude Code. Some features may vary between versions.

faq.question: What are the size limits for skills?
faq.answer: SKILL.md should be under 5000 words. Zip packages have platform-specific size limits.

faq.question: How do skills integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Skills add triggers and context. Claude automatically activates relevant skills based on user requests.

faq.question: Is data from skills stored externally?
faq.answer: Skills are local files. No data is sent to external servers by the skill system itself.

faq.question: Why does validation fail?
faq.answer: Common issues: missing SKILL.md, invalid frontmatter, TODO placeholders, or empty resource directories.

faq.question: How do skills differ from MCP tools?
faq.answer: Skills provide knowledge and workflows. MCP tools provide external tool integrations. They complement each other.
